message.content:
{"id": "27869", 
 "title": "StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData", 
 "description": "The StyledText component in Eclipse overuses the Font.getFontData API. Additionally, the FontMetrics API is also heavily used by StyledText. It is recommended to cache the metric information in StyledText and update it only when the font is changed. The default English encoding on Redhat 8 is UTF-8.", 
 "OB": "When running Eclipse and using the Java Editor, a single keystroke can trigger the Font.getFontData API to be called 13 times. Additionally, this API is overused when scrolling the StyledText and selecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, so typing the letter 'a' in the Java Editor can load 91 (7*13) FontData.", 
 "EB": "", 
 "SR": ""}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '27869', 'title': 'Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData', 'description': 'Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData Btw, UTF8is the default english encoding for Redhat 8.FontMetrics API is also very used by the StyledText, I believe that the metricinformation should be cached in the StyledText and update only when the font ischanged. ', 'OB': "Running eclipse, using the Java Editor: A single key stroke can cause the APIFont.getFontData() to be called 13 times. This API is also overused when we are scrolling the StyledText andselecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, therefore everytime I type 'a' in the JavaEditor 91 (713) FontData will be loaded. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
